title: Built a small site to track AI jobs in Australia, worth continuing?
optimized_headline: Is a Small AI Job Tracking Site in Australia Worth the Effort?
raw_excerpt:
I’ve been noticing that most AI/ML jobs in Australia are scattered across global job boards.

raw_body:
I’ve been noticing that most AI/ML jobs in Australia are scattered across global job boards.
Makes it tough to get a clear picture of what’s actually happening here, both for job seekers and for companies hiring.
So I put together a simple landing page for “AI Jobs Australia” just to see if there was any interest.
https://aijobsaustralia.com.au/
Posted it on Reddit and, to my surprise, a few people signed up on the waitlist.
The idea isn’t just to list jobs but also to show trends, e.g. which industries are hiring, what skills are in demand, etc.
Curious what people here think. If you live in Aus, would this be helpful?
Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=45021734
Points: 3
# Comments: 2
speedrun: A new site called 'AI Jobs Australia' aims to consolidate AI and machine learning job listings in Australia, which are often scattered across global boards. Initial interest is promising, with a few people signing up on the waitlist. This matters now because it addresses the challenges faced by both job seekers and employers in navigating the local job market.
why_it_matters: Job seekers in Australia can find localized AI job listings, making their search easier and more efficient.
Companies looking for talent can access a focused platform, improving their chances of finding suitable candidates quickly.

lenses.eli12: Imagine trying to find a specific book in a huge library, but the books are all mixed up. That's how job seekers feel when looking for AI jobs in Australia. This new site helps organize those listings, making it easier for people to find what they need. It’s important because it connects job hunters with opportunities right in their backyard.
lenses.pm: For product managers, 'AI Jobs Australia' fills a gap by providing a focused platform for job listings. This can help meet user needs for localized job searches and offer a competitive edge in attracting talent. A practical next step would be to gather user feedback to refine features like trends and skill demands.
lenses.engineer: The 'AI Jobs Australia' site uses a simple landing page to aggregate job listings and trends in the local AI job market. While it provides a streamlined approach to job searching, its effectiveness depends on user engagement and the breadth of listings. One limitation is that it may need to compete with larger global platforms for visibility.
